solution.text:
Volume of cylinder \(= \pi r^2 \times h = \pi \times 12^2 \times 65 = 29417.14 cm^3\)
Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 29417.14 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 26 \times 24 \times h = 29417.14 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {29417.14}{26 \times 24} = 47.14\)
The new cuboid is 47.14 cm tall

content.text: A metal cylinder of height 65 cm and radius 12 cm is melted and reshaped into a cuboid of length 26 cm and breadth 24 cm. No metal was wasted during this process. How tall is the new cuboid?

hint.text: If no metal is wasted, both objects will have the same volume.

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 125 \times 40 + \frac 12 \times 54\times(125 + 95)\)
\(= 10940 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 5 km/hr = 5000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 10940 \times 5000 = 54700000 m^3/hr\)
= 54700 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 54700\)
= 9189600 megalitres

content.text: The Vashishti river flows into the Arabian Sea. The cross-section of the river can be approximated as the shape shown in the diagram below. Therefore, volume of rain water harvested \(= 53114.29 \times 12 = 637371.43 cm^3\)
1 L \(= 1000cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow\)Volume of rain water harvested \(= 637.37 L\)

solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{29}2 \times 4 + 2 \pi \times \frac{6}2 \times 4 + 2\pi({\frac{29}2}^2 - {\frac{6}2}^2)\)
= 1705\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1705 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 341

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of 29 cm and an inner diameter of 6 cm. Its length is 4 cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?

hint.text: Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims

solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 6034.29 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {18}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {18}{2} - 5)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {18}2)^2-\pi (\frac {18}2 - m)^2}\)
= 29.54 cm

\(= \pi (20)^2 \times 34 - \pi(16)^2 \times 34\)
= 15387.43\( cm^3\)
\(Mass = Volume \times Density\)

Since the tiles can be perfectly broken into smaller parts, the number of tiles required is the area of the floor divided by the area of each tile. Also, remember that \(1m^2 = 10000 cm^2\)
Therefore, Number of tiles = 330000

Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 16 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 16000\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 47 cm and its diameter is 7 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 57 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 9541.71 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (13)^2 \times 44 - \pi (13-x)^2 \times 44\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{44\pi}=13^2 - (13-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (13-x)^2 = 169 - \frac{V}{44\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 13 - 10\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 176 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{176}{\pi} = 56 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 176 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 176 + 56\)
= 73.6 \(cm^2\)

solution.text:

\(\frac 12 \times a \times b + \frac 12 (b + e)(c + d) + \frac 12 \times e \times f + \frac 12 \times g \times (d+f) + \frac 12 \times (a+c) \times g\)
\(= \frac 12 \times 22 \times 23 + \frac 12 \times 50.5 \times 34 + \frac 12 \times 27.5 \times 16.5 + \frac 12 \times 22 \times 27.5 + \frac 12 \times 45 \times 22\)
\(=2256.875 cm^2\)

Observe the shapes carefully and see if you can break them down into smaller shapes to make calculating the areas easier. Remember the following formulas:
Area of Rectangle: \(length \times breadth\)
Area of Square: \(length^2\)
Area of a Triangle: \(\frac 12 \times base \times height\)
Area of Parallelogram: \(base \times height\)

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 4158\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{4158}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{4158}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {4158\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 21 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 10.5 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 14553 cm^3\)

\(= 154000\) L

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 416 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(416 m^2\)
Therefore, \(416 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{416}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{4}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 2 metres

Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(51.2 \times 15\)
= Rs. 768
